sentences.english: Hank fixed his sights on a 15-year-old sports car.
sentences.chinese: 汉克却独独对一辆已有十五年车龄的跑车很欣赏。
然而独独没有包括母乳。

sentences.english: Nature had endowed the rest of the human race with a sixth sense and left me out.
sentences.chinese: 大自然赋予其余的所有的人第六感觉却独独漏掉了我。

sentences.english: And say for you that the sun don't shine.
sentences.chinese: 抱怨阳光独独不为你而绚丽？

sentences.english: The roots of great innovation are never just in the technology itself.
sentences.chinese: 伟大的创新并不独独发源于技术领域。

definition: only/just (i.e. it is only that...)/all except/unique

(indicates that sth turns out just the opposite of what one would wish) unfortunately/as it happened/(indicates that sth is the opposite of what would be normal or reasonable) stubbornly/contrarily/against reason/(indicates that sb or a group is singled out) precisely/only/of all people
did I ever ...? (or "did he ever ...?" etc)
by coincidence/it so happened that/fortunately/against expectation
